1.text: Whisk 2 or 3 eggs with salt and pepper.

2.text: Melt 1 teaspoon (4.9 ml) of oil and 1 teaspoon (4 g) of butter in a skillet.

3.text: Pour the beaten eggs into the pan.

4.text: Cook the omelette and tilt the pan mixture until the omelette's almost set.

5.text: Add your choice of fillings if you want to make a heartier omelette.

6.text: Turn off the burner and fold the omelette in half.

7.text: Beat 3 eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper.

8.text: Melt 1 tablespoon (14 g) of butter in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.

9.text: Pour the eggs into the skillet and stir them until they're softly set.

10.text: Roll the omelette over itself by 1 inch (2.5 cm) intervals.

11.text: Slide the rolled omelette onto a plate so the seam is facing down.
